column1: Loncoche (Mapudungun: head of an important person) is a city and commune in the Araucanía Region
column2: southern Chile. It is located near the border to Los Ríos Region and the city of Lanco.

column1: Loncoche is a major centre for milk production. Loncoleche is the main milk and dairy product producer in the zone.
Pablo Neruda wrote a poem called "Aromos rubios en los campos de Loncoche".
According to the 2002 census of the National Statistics Institute
column2: Loncoche spans an area of 976.8 km2 (377 sq mi) and has 23
column8: 814 (33.9%) in rural areas. The population fell by 2.6% (606 persons) between the 1992 and 2002 censuses.

column2: Loncoche is a third-level administrative division of Chile administered by a municipal council
column3: headed by an alcalde who is directly elected every four years. The 2008-2012 alcalde is Ricardo Peña Riquelme (RN).Within the electoral divisions of Chile
column4: Loncoche is represented in the Chamber of Deputies by René Manuel García (RN) and Fernando Meza (PRSD) as part of the 52nd electoral district
column9: Gorbea and Toltén). The commune is represented in the Senate by José Garcia Ruminot (RN) and Eugenio Tuma Zedan (PPD) as part of the 15th senatorial constituency (Araucanía-South). There are two high schools - Liceo Bicentenario P. Alberto Hurtado Cruchaga and Santa Cruz.
